On october 21, 2013
SanguinisRose

It just goes to show your shadow can appear scarier then what you really are.
On october 21, 2013
lordwok

A Post Apocalyptic Love Story
or Baby Needs Her Fix

Part 1

It started like it always does, boy meets girl and... well you know the rest. We were happy in the before-time, things were good and life was like a bright new day, shiny and full of the promise of good things to come.

I'll always remember the feeling i had that morning when i woke up and knew right away something had changed, the wind was blowing the sickly smell of ordure and rot and a blanket of silence lay over the entire town....something felt...wrong

One look out the window at the bodies in the street and i knew we had to leave, i started packing before she even woke up. I don't even think we had a destination in mind, just AWAY... anywhere had to be better that what was left of our once-lovely hometown.

We must have driven for days, i dont know how many they all blur into each other......... every gas station we came across was either unattended or scattered with corpses but we stopped long enough to refuel and grab some packaged food before setting out again.

I was scared out of my mind but i had to put on a brave front for her, she wasnt copeing well and spent long periods just blankly stareing out the window while we passed through towns and villages that had been dredged up from somebodys worst nightmare. Houses and buildings sprayed with gore,some of them had obviously been torn open by... something to get at the people inside. Their remains were scattered across lawns and gardens, i stopped to look the first time and wished i hadnt, some of those remains had what looked like bite marks on the bones.....

Eventually we found one, a thing-person... "it" was shambleing by the side of the road and turned to look at me as we slowed down. Half of its face was gone and blood was caked around its mouth and down the front of the tattered clothes it was wearing. I couldnt tell whether it has been a man or a woman but whatever it was, it just wasnt human anymore.

She started screaming at me to "drive DRIVE" and i quickly sped back up again but that was the breaking point, she barely spoke unless i asked her a direct question after that and even then she seemed numb and just mumbled part of a response before trailing off and turning to stare at nothing again...

I started trying to avoid built up areas, there were more of "them" wherever people had been and we found ourselves way out in the country near the desert, i stopped in a small town to scavenge for supplies and found a drugstore. I thought maybe they would have something that would help her get by and hastily grabbed an armload of different bottles of pills intending to sort through them once we were far away from any houses which might contain more of those things.

I had been driving all day everyday for what seemed like weeks so when i woke up the next morning bleary eyed and groggy i wasnt surprised i had fallen asleep hunched over the wheel after we ran out of gas someplace in the middle of nowhere.

I turned to make sure she was ok and saw the empty pill bottles scattered all over the car.. it was first thing in the morning and im not ashamed to say i sort of lost it, she was lieing there, awake but sort of vacant-eyed and i started screaming and shakeing her but she just smiled and told me to relax.

I was kind of shocked to hear her speak in a normal tone of voice and the last time i had seen her smile was several lifetimes ago so i stopped yelling right away. "Are you ok?" i asked and frantically started trying to read the pill bottles to see what she had taken and how much. Most of the labels were faded or gone altogether so i had no idea what to think or do, maybe i should try to make her vomit? eventually i calmed down enough to stop and take stock of our situation. We were out of gas with very few supplies and stuck out on the edge of the desert.




stay tuned for next weeks episode kids! same bat-time. same bat-channel!

On october 25, 2013
lordwok

"A Post Apocalyptic Love Story"
or
"Baby Needs Her Fix"

Part Deux:

So there we were... smack damn in the middle of nowhere, no gas, no hope and no idea how things could possibly get any worse. Well we all know what happens when you tempt fate dont we?

It started as a faint echo reflecting off the few stunted trees still trying to eke out a living in this arid antechamber to hades...

I looked around not sure i had actually heard anything and after a moment returned to packing our meager food supplies into my backpack. After a minute or two i heard it again, this time much louder.. a long drawn out moaning.. part scream, part deathrattle.

It wasnt a sherlock holmes case, one of the things was obviously nearby and by the sounds of it.. coming closer...
I hurriedly threw the last few packets of stale chips and a half eaten chicken drumstick into my pack and got out of the car. She had loaded HER pack with nothing but bottles of pills, i wanted to say something but one look at the defiant expression on her face and i swallowed what i was going to say, took her hand and we set off down the road in the opposite direction from the noise.

The next few hours were a gruesome death march, we had to pass car after fuel-less car of dead people, each one a little stephan king novel in its own right. Here was the religious family that had died on their knees praying to a god that was surely incapable of mercy, there, another family with a more pragmatic approach. The father had shot his wife and 4 small children then turned the gun on himself... for miles afterwards i found myself wondering if they were the lucky ones.

Eventually we came to a gas station just as the sun was touching the horizon, we stopped for a moment and watched for any signs of movement but it seemed to be deserted. As we drew closer we had to skirt around a prime mover that had jackknifed in the parking lot.

Just as we passed the cab a gigantic THING burst out from underneath the pile of twisted metal and let out a spine chilling roar. It was so close i could SMELL the decay, there was no doubt this one had been a man, it towered head and shoulder above me and i just froze like a deer in the headlights.

I couldnt move, i couldnt think, all i could see was this monstrosity bearing down on me with the inevitable force of a tsunami. But my baby, she was something else~ she picked up a rusty length of chain that had been used to secure the trucks load and whipped it at the thing's leg shearing it off just below the kneecap. It faceplanted so close to me i could have reached down and touched it.... then she just started flailing at it like a madwoman, screaming at the top of her lungs. She had a two handed grip on the chain now and was using powerful overhand strokes... again and again and again.... after i came back to myself i turned to the side and just vomited, bits of its flesh were all over my face and clothing, i heaved until there was nothing left and then kept retching...

She put her hand on my shoulder as i wiped my mouth, i looked up with eyes that were still blurred by tears and just hugged her in a deathgrip like i never wanted to let go. "Shhh its ok its ok" she said and stroked my hair. Ive never been so proud in my life and realized that as long as we had each other it was worth going on.......

We scavenged some food and water from the gas station store but the pumps didnt work and i couldnt find any fuel anywhere. After spending a cold and sleepless night on the roof listening to the screams of the almost-dead echoing back and forth we set off down the highway.... together.....




Stay tuned to DIEradio folks for the next installment in this thrilling RomZom drama!

On november 24, 2013
MadDonut

In eagerness to begin this contest, I'm giving a six hour deadline for a third person to volunteer as a judge.

Don't fret if you wish to write something, me or BlackVoid can easily do the task. It's a preference that someone else from the Die2Nite community volunteers, but also the more stories the merrier!
Unless you're one of our judges..



Here's a reminder how it all goes down, so save it somewhere if you plan to compete here a lot:

Each story is rated out of three hundred possible points (or a hundred per judge). For the Overall Leaderboard, each contestants' points are divided by the number of rounds they participated in, then their score is improved by the number of rounds they participated in (+10 ; icon = ) and the number of rounds they've won (+5 ; icon = ).
Algebraicallys = p/i + 10i + 5w

s meaning total score.
p meaning points of all stories together.
i meaning number of rounds participated in.
w meaning number of rounds won.

Here are the rewards for Die2Write: The Writings of Death :

15x Hero Days (or 1x MTPass) for first place.
3x Creative medals* for first place.
2x Creative medals* for second place.
1x Creative medals* for third place.
5x Chatevent* icons for first, second, and third place.
5x Starevent* icons for each judge.

*unique, consumable forum icons provided by the English AnimACTION team! Creative medals are special medals that can unlock distinct titles, if you have enough of them. They are also provided by the English AnimACTION team.

Welcome to the fourth installment of Die2Write!
Ladies and gentlemen, with great pride, I present:

Die2Write: The Writings of Death

Round One's theme is:
"Left in Passing"
When one draws their last breath, there's a lot they leave behind. Sometimes it can be a grand fortune, inherited by their lucky grandchild. Sometimes it's a haunted mansion, inherited by their unlucky grandchild. What kind of things can you think of that the dead seem to always leave about?

Round One ends: December 1st, 2013.

On november 29, 2013
FeelinHawt

Unwanted Birthrights

I don't know how many days we have held up in this dry, dark, rusted excuse of a town. But one thing that makes it a little less painful to bear is my father. My mother had died before we stumbled across this town. My father said it was because she was... weak and I had to be strong to survive in this world. My father had never lost a member of his group while scavenging the wastelands but the other groups weren't always so lucky. I tell my friends it's because my father is strong and brave and I will be just like him one day. My fathers group has been doing so well the town leader has disband all other groups to train with my father's group. But that's when the trouble started.

The next day my father's group lost their first member to the hoard. I remember everyone yelling and screaming at each other my father at them, them at my father. It scared me... but I must be strong I said to myself.

Everyday after that they lost another member... some days maybe 2. As the days went on I started to notice they were blaming my father more and more. Someone even said to my father "We know it's you and if we find out that it is..." My father would tell me they just needed someone to blame, that it makes life easier on the town and I should not worry. How naive I was.

As things seemed to get worse the gallows went up. All eyes were on my father and I could not understand why. My father must have known because he told me about a place where he had been storing food and supplies. Not long after that they hung him, leaving me to fend for myself in this world. But I must be strong.

Now I find it hard to work with the other townfolk and I think people are starting to distrust and shun me. While I was gone someone took everything from my house and said "It would be safer in the bank." I think it's time for me to leave this town.

As I am walking out of the gates I remember about my father stash of supplies. After searching under a few wrong rocks I find it, inside my father's hidding spot is some food, water and a note. It seems to be dated and is addressed to me. As I start reading it I realise that it is from my father. It talks about how he would give me and mother most of the food and water and it was making him weaker untill he stumbled across a corpse. He mentions almost starving so he ate some of the loose meat on the corpse. After that his writing gets harder to understand. It says something about an uncontrolable hungar and about how he had tried his best to repress it untill he took his hungar out on her. After that the note talks about my father needing to be strong for me, to resist.

As i'm walking away from that town listening to the siren echoing around me warning of tonights attack, I can't help but think about what my father's note said about him taking his "hungar" out on a her. Could it have been my mother? And what could he have done to the towns people to get himself hung? All I know is my father left me with questions and a mindset... I must be strong.
On november 30, 2013
DarkTheRaven

Out of curiosity, is english your first language? I've just noticed a few things that pique my interest. If you feel like it, answer truthfully or not at all, either way won't change my opinion of any writer if they have perfect spelling or grammar
On november 30, 2013
goob

Tears travelled down Cassandra's cheek as she sat on the padded floor in the tent, waiting for the inevitable. Daniel was sleeping in a cot a few feet away from her, or perhaps he had slipped into a coma. It was too hard to tell anymore.

In her quivering hands was a photograph of Daniel she had taken during their honeymoon in Montana last year. His "Save a Tree, Eat a Vegan" hat had been muddied from their hiking trip, but he still beamed with happiness as she photographed him in the glaring afternoon sun. He had bought the hat in a gift shop the day before the trip, solely because Cassandra was a long-time vegan. His quirky sense of humor was one of the many things she loved about him. She vowed to never forget the memories of their honeymoon since memories were about all she had left.

She glanced over to make sure he was still breathing, stroked his dark and wavy hair, and put the photograph on the floor. Her eyes were drawn to his journal which had fallen out of his hands some time during the night. He had started one a few weeks ago when they saw the announcement on the television telling them to move to a nearby refugee camp where more advanced medical facilities were available. Daniel had to give up his writing career when they moved since they now had higher priorities, mainly that of survival. Although it would never earn him any royalties, writing in a journal gave him a little peace of mind in a world where nothing was predictable and where nothing would ever be the same.

Turning to the last page on which he had written, Cassandra read his barely legible words with both fear and comfort, knowing it would likely be his last gift to her.

"March 8, 2013. My leg hurts bad. I know this is probably the end. The drugs help ease the pain but they don't hide the truth. There's still no cure for the bite and the infection is spreading. I know I don't have much time left, so I want to write this while my mind is still somewhat clear. Cassie, my life with you has been nothing but wonderful. You gave my life purpose when it had none. Never did I think I would find someone as beautiful and loving as you."

Although she wasn't finished, Cassandra stopped reading and wiped her eyes. The tears blurred her vision and made the last entry impossible to read. She grabbed one of Daniel's shirts on the floor, dabbed her eyes with it, and quietly sobbed as she clutched the journal tightly against her chest. She didn't want it to end this way.

Her thoughts were interrupted by someone yelling in the distance, "There's another one!" This sudden outburst reminded her of where she was and what was going to happen. She put Daniel's journal on the floor and wondered when she would have the strength to finish reading his final message, his final gift to her. Would it be days? Weeks? Months? She didn't know.

After drying her tears one last time, she put the photograph inside the journal and then covered the journal with the shirt to prevent it from being stained with blood. With trepid hesitation she picked up the pistol, turned to face Daniel, and waited, ignoring the single tear starting to make its way down her cheek.

Ponycornio Message

Uhmmm....O__O

Write in english make me that I can't write as I usually do it.

Title: History of Historys

I opened my mind when I found a short history inside a bottle.It was almost like a message from a shipwrecked person. Only that this was a sea of sand.

Written are inmune to death. This novel idea was growing in my mind taking his own life‚Ä¶This epiphany It was the point of no return and I didn‚Äôt want to come back.

I started collecting written of dead people‚Ä¶ Sometimes I founded‚Ä¶ one simply letter‚Ä¶ a diary or even a napkin‚Ä¶ His last Words fit on it‚Ä¶

I left town and get into desert‚Ä¶ there I will be safe I used the lost soul to survive and write‚Ä¶
Old chaman only use soul for emergency‚Ä¶


They were limited by useless rules. They didn‚Äôt leave fly their imagination.

Always and always‚Ä¶

They couldn‚Äôt go away from limits.

I try to open their consciense‚Ä¶but they didn‚Äôt want to know‚Ä¶



I should transcend and there have only a way make written...
False or True‚Ä¶Now this doesn‚Äôt any sense It will not to be important.

Which each written I was more close‚Ä¶

I wrote with mi own blood and soul gave energy it‚Ä¶ life‚Ä¶I could fell mi own essence‚Ä¶ whispering words with only one touch.


I travelled through the desert‚Ä¶ far away‚Ä¶I hitting written near town, cities, houses‚Ä¶
Each new written was a new life‚Ä¶part of me‚Ä¶of us...


First time that I saw how it Works I marvelled at that beautifull view!

A young man found he took it and which any word reading‚Ä¶.which any word be whispering‚Ä¶I felt like is energy left him a came to me.

Memories, illusions, dream,knowledge his own identity, his conscience now I was part of me.
It was mine, They were mine‚Ä¶
We were are and will be One.


Now different posibility are opened‚Ä¶ Now there isn‚Äôt nothing imposible‚Ä¶good or evil, true or false now there are concepts that didn‚Äôt have sense‚Ä¶


‚Ä¶This are different days‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt need souls for give life to written that contain part of me par of my almost dead past readers...I can use his energy my energy...

Zombies never come back to be the first danger of the world‚Ä¶I need more power and they stole me humans that could be future reader.

They will be destroy.

And then‚Ä¶when I finish here I will go away from this tiny world.


Autor: Yanakawa>>>The Writer.


Pd: Do you feel like you are changing or this certainty was obfuscate for this marveled feeling of read this history until finish it‚Ä¶and there isn‚Äôt way to stop because do you think that this sense was part of you?

Left behind Things that you didn‚Äôt know that you was left‚Ä¶Things that you will never be again‚Ä¶

Don‚Äôt worry be happy‚Ä¶

In anyway you can be safe that you aren‚Äôt going to died‚Ä¶

Your conscience will live on me on our written‚Ä¶and other forms‚Ä¶

You only left behind your empty body and my history wait to join of be reading again and whisper new work in this future reader while transfer this new information...

Left behind a new empty body and our history waiting again for a new reader.

You (in plural xD) will be us.
Ponycornio's time are coming O__O

And Pink Ponycornio.

On december 6, 2013
Jean-Ralphio

Here goes nothing.
I call it: Boyz to Shamen


They say all you leave behind is your bones.
That's fine with me, mighty fine indeed.
I want dem bones, wit a wee bit o meat on the end. MMMMm mm! Got to git me those bones!

But what they say aint true in the least. Not one bit see, cause you leave more den just those bones. Ya'll also leave your souls.
Now that's when the 'teresting stuff happens.
Those blue wisps of plasms filled with pain and regret fill me wit power. A mighty power indeed.

Go forth all you scouts, go forth and gather me these souls. I feel them, I feel them in my living bones. Taste them in my throat. Bring dem to me and i will inhale the sorrow and exhale our salvation.

The gift of death is out there and will delay our own demise, for at least a day.

Ah good, you brought me old SnicKer's bone, naughty ting theres no meat left! I wonder where that could have gone ho ho! No matter, still useful to me.
And is that... it is isn't it, its Dave's soul! My oh my i never thought i would see his.
wheeeeeezzzeeeee
Ahhhhh yeeeeesssssss dat's good Dave you are far more useful dead than you ever were alive. Your fear burns my eyes, i can feel t'eir glow and i see nothing but light. And your regret; how it lightens my body. Dave I can hardly feel the earth at my feet. What's this? You were lonely above everything else? OH how that stirs my loins. Everything you were I now feel in ecstasy.
Here it comes. A rain cloud manifest of death and agony to deliver us another day of life.

Moisture! Moisture in dis air! How long has it been since we've felt the humidity. Tonight it will form into a cloud and the cloud will rain liquid life upon the undead.

Tomorrow you will find SnicKer's soul and bring it to me. it will save us again. But after that we will have to make some new souls.

one way... or another
On december 7, 2013
SanguinisRose

One in the Chamber


The 22nd of October, 24AC, was the day I was born, many people would call any of us born after the collapse an accident, though according to my father he couldn't have been happier to see my face when I was born. I later saw a birth of my friend William and can only assume that my birth was the same, a midwife quarantined off with the mother, with the rest of the town circling the area with weapons drawn just in case the child or the mother should die. It took me several years for the severity of the zombies at our gates to be thought of as a threat, around the age of ten I think common sense finally developed in my brain. It was about the time when my father would tell his stories of the past, the days before the zombies. No one really explained how the end came about, there were many theories, my father's was about a make-up company creating the zombie virus, something about Olay creating an anti-aging foam in a bottle that resembled the same container as a movie. We were young, sitting before the campfire at night, the stories we heard fables of a long ago kingdom that had boxes with motors in them, it fascinated us to no end. That's all they were to us, stories, too unbelievable that zombies didn't exist, or that large pieces of steel could fly through the sky.

Years passed, and the final gunshot was heard two weeks after my fifteenth birthday, the town had seen the last of the rounds that they had horded. It was the same day that my father told me that his most valued possession other then myself was under his bed, as he drank from a bottle of vodka, he also explained to me that it was one of the few things that let him wake up in the morning hoping that the day would be better. I learned a few weeks later why he was drunk that day, my father had been the one to shoot the zombie that night, my mother who had vanished right after my birth.

Soon after my father gained more responsibility, going on the expeditions that were now going further then they have ever gone before, apparently our luck had run out in the surrounding area, Christmas Michigan had nothing useful anymore. Our first warning of things to come was when the expedition team didn't come back, we waited several days after their scheduled return before we officially stated the news. The expedition team was dead, my father was dead, a friend tried to explain this as inevitable that someday he would die, that it just happened to be today that it happened. He soon found out that those are not the words to comfort a child, my father was untouchable before that, infallible, to have him taken away was something unimaginable.

It seemed like the world mourned his death as well, or maybe it was just the shaman that stayed in the town, the sky was black with dark clouds that flashed with lightning. The rain that fell down soaked into my bones as I stared up at the sky, the crack of thunder washing away the pain that seeped into me with every breath. When I went back to my father's shack, I had an excuse for my cheeks to be covered in water, and an excuse to sleep in a fever now sweeping over me. The next day, in a cold sweat I woke up, it sounded like the crack of thunder once again aroused me from sleep but it didn't seem to be raining.

‚ÄúThe horde, they've found us!‚Äù A yell rang out over the town's loudspeaker, and I was outside before my feet had time to register the ground. My vision was filled with the rotten flesh, if this is what my father ran into there was no way that he would have been able to escape. I stepped back as I realized that the end was near, the town watch was being pushed back hard. My heart hammered against my chest as the cold drops of sweat fell to my arm feeling as though it was burning me as the slam of my front door filled the blur of my vision, the couch hitting it like a truck. I knew it was selfish, that I should be outside with the others fighting off the undead, but fear made my choice for me as I went to my father's room, locking the deadbolt behind me as I sat beside the bed hoping that the zombies wouldn't notice me. Tucking my chin against my knees, I watched the door, the screams outside I knew would haunt my dreams should I survive this, my imagination working even harder with my fever, a sudden slam against the house making me scurry from the corner of the room under the bed.

Pushed against the wall at the head of the bed was a box of polished redwood lay against the floor, a small Celtic cross spread across the top of the box. Taking it in my hand I slid it to me, running my hand across the top of it as I heard wood groan then crack in the distance. Lifting the lid revealed a red silk inside, laying in the middle of it was a pistol and I took it into my hand the cold of its grip seemed to suck the heat out of my hand. It didn't seem to have anything in the clip, but a single round in the pistol, it made me laugh a little remembering my father's words. A single bullet loaded into a pistol, this was his precious treasure, the thing that let him live on through these days? Shaking my head I looked back just in time to see the door fly open, a man falling to the ground and his soulless eyes staring at me.

Thunder cracked out once more that night....
On december 7, 2013
Colette

Remnants
by Colette

‚ÄúI still can't believe it. Johnny was such a good guy‚Äù...

Once again his voice was filled with anger and grief. Understandable given the circumstances. But the rest of us felt differently. We weren't willing to go through another round of useless emotional complaints again. We were hungry and exhausted. We had too much to worry about to care about the grief of one of our companions.

There was no reply. We all walked silently and said no word. We were sick of his emotional outbursts, yet we cared enough not to tell him to shut up. As tears started filling up his eyes again, Joe, the leader of our expedition, ran off into the desert.

Victor was one of the last citizens that arrived in town seeking for refuge, and one of our companions in that expedition. A reliable man, if too outspoken in everyone's opinion. He stared at Joe, surprised.

‚ÄúWho the hell made that clown our leader?‚Äù, Victor complained. ‚ÄúThe idiot leaves us here and he has the machete with him.‚Äù

When Joe was gone, the rest of us stared at each other, wordless. Nobody wanted to chase him and console him. But we did felt a bit guilty about it.

‚ÄúWe shouldn't be too hard on the guy‚Äù, someone said. ‚ÄúYeah. Poor bastard's lost his little bro‚Äù, someone else added. I just listened to what they said. Not that I could really blame them. Dealing with the feeling of loss is never easy.

The fact was that none of us felt too sad. None of us felt we had lost anything. Joe's brother, Johnny was the most useless citizen in town. He would stay at home most of his time, never getting his hands dirty out in the construction sites or risking life and limb scavenging outside. From that point of view, he was nothing but dead weight for the town. Joe had always told us that Johnny had a heart disease since he was little, so he could barely do any physical work. The community was aware of it, and frankly we weren't happy about it. He was another mouth to feed and another daily water ration less in our well. These difficult times have reminded us that survival belongs to the fittest. More than often, we cannot afford to take care of the sick anymore.

The saddest thing was that Johnny was fully aware of his condition, but still he could not do anything to change it. He tried to be useful to town, delivering messages or doing whatever small tasks he could to help. But that wasn't enough. Joe didn't make things easier for us. Joe refused to risk his brother's life for the town, and constantly encouraged him to rest and avoid doing anything. Blood is thicker than water, they say, but we didn't appreciate that situation too much.

A few days earlier, our expedition had discovered an abandoned supermarket a few kilometers away from the town. Going there and returning would be an easy job, so we decided to leave it for later and focus on another expedition that would take us further way. However, Johnny learned about it and decided to go out to the desert by himself to prove his worth. That proved to be his fatal mistake. If anyone goes out to the desert and doesn't come back in two days, you can be sure you will never see them again. Joe knew it, and no matter how much he clung on to hope, he eventually had to accept the fact that Johnny was dead.

We continued our lives like usual. We cannot afford to stop and grieve over our neighbors' deaths. The undead come back every night. More and more every night. We cannot stop for a second.

Ever since that day, Joe started to complain and cry every day. And he often started acting erratically. He was assigned to be the leader of the expedition because he knew the way to the building we were going to explore. He had also discovered that supermarket, and had been the one to tell his brother about it. Guilt and anger must have become unbearable for him, and that day must have been his breaking point. We all were sick of his complaints and we weren't willing to keep supporting them. Perhaps he felt betrayed when he ran off. But he didn't come back. We also felt a bit of remorse and looked for him, but he was nowhere to be seen. It was getting dark, and our search efforts were fruitless. It was time to go back to town. Perhaps he had run off on purpose to find a way of leaving this world, hoping he would be reunited with his family on another.

Three days later. I woke up when I heard a strange noise outside. It was past midnight, so all zombies were gone. But it was a sound reminiscent of their footsteps. Someone walking slowly, shuffling their feet. Against my better judgment, I went outside to investigate. We didn't want a stray zombie to be walking out in town anyway.

When I reached the town's plaza, I felt surprised to see someone standing in the middle of it. Not just someone. A familiar face. There was Joe, staring at the sky. His face illuminated by the moonlight. Nobody thought he would make it back alive. He was talking. Talking to himself, lost in feverish delusion of pain and grievance. I got close to him. I don't think he saw or heard me, but I overheard what he said. ‚ÄúI am one with my brother now. He will live on forever inside of me‚Äù.

That morning, citizens were surprised to find a corpse in the middle of the plaza. A partially rotten and decomposed corpse. It was Joe. But he seemed different. Under his uniform, we saw his skin had already started to decompose, very much like the skin of a zombie. I had heard of them. Zombies that keep part of their human mind and memories, and barely show any signs of change. He had been killed when someone hit his head with a large rock. I left my home and walked to the plaza to see what had happened, pretending I didn't know about it. Poor Joe. When he found his brother's corpse, he should have known that the only thing a dead person leaves behind are their mortal remnants, and nothing can be done to bring them back to life.

On december 7, 2013
SaucyemmettC

Last Words

The voices in my brain are driving me insane. Are? Or am? Am I insane because I hear voices in my brain, or is it that the voices drive me insane and I am still sane to be driven insane? Words. This all started with words. Words hold great power, if not all power. But what is power? Power is, what one would say is strength. But is it? Do words hold strength or power? Is power strength? Or is power something more omnipotent than strength, on a whole other tier. Can strength string together a chorus, which spreads chaos? Perhaps‚Ä¶ So yes. I think power is strength. And strength is power. And words‚Ä¶ Words are powerful. For you see, it is words, that tempt, my sanity. Why else would I shake and writhe and spit and whine? Because the voices in my mind are alive! It all started with words. Words which built up. They brought me here. And how do I feel about this? For feeling is what? An emotion, or a thought‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know. I think I did once, but I forgot. Forgot the words to explain or the whole memory? Is a memory made of words? Is everything a word? Or are words just labels? When I think I hear words, words which stack to make sentences to make thoughts or memories or emotions. Anger is an emotion. But anger is a word. And when I think of anger I think hot, and hot is a word. Heat produces energy, and energy produces power. Power is not in words, words are power. And I have words. Many many words. Does that make me powerful? Or am I just a host? A host to these words in which the voices in my head speak? That man. That damn man and his damn words. He brought me here. Now. And he awoke the voices. Or did the voices awaken him? Were the voices even in me to start, or did his words birth them? I believe that the voices are always in me but I didn‚Äôt believe that until they were always with me. And they are always with me but was there a time when there wasn‚Äôt? Am I just a voice myself? A voice all the other voices are voicing off to? Is this meat I wear my meat or am I myself a voice who stole it from another? Am I that man, his words‚Ä¶ They billowed from his mouth‚Ä¶ And they broke me‚Ä¶ They made me‚Ä¶ I am but words now, and I always was. And so are you. He lay there in the heat. A crumpled mess of meat. So dry, all his life sucked up by the sky! The sun, it burned! But what is the sun? The sun is energy, which is why it is so hot. For energy produces heat, and energy produces power. Power is words, and so the sun is a word. The more they sing and cry and shriek, the more more more more more more more more more life grows bleak! Bleak not because of understanding. Bleak because everything is a word. Sun, moon, sky, sand, death, life, love, hate! All around me! Words! All starting from that man lying in the sand. And from him to me to Paul and Saul! Across the lands, the sands, I see! And who knew, that the simplest of stories could spark such a cry! But the simplest of cries can awaken the whole horde, as I know. The man in the sand told me a simple story, one I am unwilling to share now, because it has been quieted, let loose. Now, everyone, all around, has stories to tell. Each story‚Ä¶ Brought forth life! Life to the land! And now I sit here with a pen in my hand, and for what? Words? That is all I am, blood, skin, heart, brain, soul. Words! And within words are more words! Thoughts, feelings, emotion! And within those are the voices, who spectate and make sanction for more words. The words. The words that make up sentences which make up my predicament. I sit here, thinking, listening, writing, I am words, I create words, for words create me. All from the man in the sand with his final story. Blood. Blood encased him. Crumpled mess. Bloody fuss. Cough. Lots of that. He was made of words and from his lips words erupted. A simple story, of his past. He spoke. Snap. Boom. And the voice in my brain started to sing. Sing his story. And then later, at a pub ‚ÄúOut of The Sun‚Äù, an epic tale by a cannibal! A story of love and loss, the loss of the Unbalanced Counties. And poof, another voice, not a new voice, for no new words are around. Because words are already here, you see, and to label something with a ‚Äúnew‚Äù word would be false. For the thing was already a word, and the label you put to the thing is a label of the word! Words are infinite! And so are their combinations! Stories! Songs! Another singing voice in my brain, ‚ÄúLight My Fire! Give me every desire!‚Äù And the soliloque by the runt! Out by the fire upon looking into the mound of burning corpses he opened his mouth and let loose another voice in my head! I hear it still. Over and over and over again! Another story, an apology left at the gates, signed and sealed. Never spoken, but sing in my brain by a voice none the less. All inside, all inside, all waiting to come outside. A pen in my hand, and a burning will to write, but what about the plight I will create. Am I willing to push the big red button to drop the big red bomb? Who am I to inspire? Who am I to lead? I am but a shallow hungry collection of words. Many many words, many many who hold power. I simply radiate power then, for the words want to come out. And so I sit with this pen and paper and write. I write to indict. I spell each word out carefully, silently, for the accursed winged beast took my tongue when I sung. And now silence. But words ache, words shake, words will themselves out. Am I me? This thought now, is it me? Or is it words with a will, a will that they bend me to. Do what the words want or want what the words offer? All started from the man in the sand. Hungry, silent, alone. I sit and I write, and I write to indict! Final words left behind, they find me. If a tree falls in the forest and no one is around to hear it does it make a word? Even if it isn't heard it makes a word. And I hear it, not me, but the voices, and they sing it to me. I hear not the word then. Do I? If the voices shriek it and I hear it do I hear the word or the voices? Another voice! Another voice! And it sings a tale of a dog named Mitzer. Hmm. Hah. And I hear it over and over and over again. The words come to me and I need to release them. If I do not what will happen? No tongue to let my words out through the front. And so I sit and I write them out this way. But I fear for myself. What when the stories leave me. A final goodbye is screamed into the night, and it comes to me. Not me but the voices. Or do the voices go to the words and then come to me? I am not the voices so I do not know. No. No. Write. Write a story, that is what I must do. Almost out of ink. Almost out of think. MUST WRITE WITH WORD. BLOOD. BLOOD. BLOOD. MUST RELEASE. WHEN I TOLD THE MAN IN THE SANDS STORY THE VOICE QUIETED. IT IS QUIET. QUIET. BUT WORDS ARE POWER. WHAT WHEN I QUIET ALL WORDS. I LOOSE POWER? BUT WHAT GOOD IS POWER? WHAT GOOD IS STRENGTH? WHEN WORDS RULE ME? AND WORDS AREN‚ÄôT MY WORDS THEY ARE WORDS WORDS WORDS! WORDS FROM LIPS I NEVER SEE WORDS FORM LIPS I NEVER HEAR‚Ä¶ AM I SANE STILL? VOICES ENGULF. SO LOUD. ANOTHER! ANOTHER TWO! ANOTHER THREE! THEY SWALLOW SWALLOW SWALLOW ME!
On december 7, 2013

On december 8, 2013
Blaire

A Riot Shield Cannot Protect Your Heart

Gone are our days as the apex predator. Gone are the days that we shaped the world to our will. Gone are the days we could go forth into the world, confident and careless, secure in mankind's superior status. Now we huddle in our wretched, little towns, living our wretched, little lives, until we inevitably meet our wretched, little deaths. Telling indeed, is it that the foremost of the Town's Watchmen, the Brotherhood of Guardians, bear not a destructive gun, nor a mighty spear, nor a swift sword, but a defensive shield. ‚ÄúDon't get me wrong; I have nothing but respect for the Brotherhood. Hell, I guess I might be considered an honorary member nowadays. But they are passive, not active. They defend humanity, but do not fight for it. But I digress, and I have a story to tell.‚Äù Even in this endtime, however, even in this world of walking corpses, scouring sands, and relentless heat, there are some who dare to go out and plumb the World Beyond for the treasures that are hidden there. The bravest amongst us (and I count myself among this venerated group, not to make to much of a big thing of myself) dare to draw near the buildings that are the pitiful remnants of our lost civilization. For while these buildings are rich in valuable resources, they are also what is technically known as ‚Äúabsolutely crawling with the buggers, you can't go two feet without hitting one of 'em‚Äù, to quote a noted expert. Among these bravest there is a certain, select, one might say ‚Äúelite‚Äù group. This subset is not known for their bravery, daring, courage, gumption, or altruism. This group is known for their insanity. For what sane man (or woman, the group is fairly evenly divided by gender, though I think that us men might have an edge on them in insanity in numbers, if not intensity)would enter a warren of zombies and poison? I am talking, of course, about those buildings commonly known as Explorable Ruins. ‚ÄúThough I tend to call them Damnable Labyrinths.‚Äù It was during my first expedition to one of these ruins, an old hospital, my initiation in the way of the wandering aimlessly, if you will, that I happed upon him. We tend to go by nicknames, so we just called him Shield, as he was the only one of the Brotherhood among us. It was a fairly average expedition, though I was simply by going by the word of my companions at the time, as I was fairly inexperienced, though some of my knowledge from exploring normal buildings transferred over. We had decided to split our group of eight into four groups of two, because frankly, we had too much ground to cover, and we could only stay in those places for about 5 minutes before the mysterious gas that covered the area took us out of commission. Funnily enough, by doing a multitude of experiments that involved pushing people we didn't like into the ruin and locking the doors, (we don't have unlimited chains, you know!) we had discovered that the amount of exertion one underwent appeared to have no effect on the time limit. For some reason or another, it was hardlocked at about five minutes before we collapsed. Unless we had to run from zombies, which for some reason drastically increased our gas intake. Don't ask me why that's how things are, I have no idea myself. Aaaaaannnnnnyyyyywwwwaaaaaaaayyyyy, this all led to the fact that we weren't walking, jogging or running through the halls. We were sprinting as fast as our malnourished, vitamin-deficient legs could take us. Shield and I were paired up, as I'm sure you've figured out. Hell if I know how he was keeping up, lugging that heavy, bulky, monstrosity (well I know now, it all lies in momentum, balance, and mysterious training that you don't have the clearance to know about, but at the time I was completely flabbergasted) and keeping up with me, but he was doing fine. We hit seven rooms, two of which were locked, unfortunately, and managed to find some assorted drugs, a blueprint for some reason (I had no idea why the blueprints for what turned out to be giant statue of a crow were in a hospital, my guess is we had entered the psychiatric ward at some point), a mattress, which I had somehow strapped to my back, and an empty vending machine. Which Shield was balancing on his riot shield, defiance of all sense, logic, and physics. Anyway, we were on our way out with about two minutes to spare (hell yeah we're fast!... though the drugs might've helped) when we hit a zombie. We fled and I somehow felt we only had about a minute and a half now. Then we hit another one. One minute. All of a sudden, things were urgent. By my count, the exit was about 30 seconds away. We couldn't afford losing another 30 seconds of air. Then we ran into another zombie. Only this one had three of his buddies with him. We idled, wasting 10 precious seconds, before Shield slammed all of them into the wall with his shield, dropping the vending machine (seriously, how the hell was he balancing that? I've gotten training, and I still can't do anything like that). ‚ÄúGo!‚Äù he shouted. ‚ÄúI'll keep them pinned!‚Äù Well far it be from me to dishonor his sacrifice, so I waltzed out of there, safe and sound, pausing only to grab the blueprint from his belt (and I will always regret wasting time on that useless thing). I quickly exited the ruin, meeting up with the rest of my group. And then I promptly broke down. Yeah, I turned on the waterworks. Wailing, crying, keening, screaming. I supposed I wasn't as cool-headed back then, but honestly... I might react the same today. He had sacrificed himself for me. To save my life. After nearly 15 minutes of gasping, wheezing, and choking, both from the anguish and the mysterious gases, I managed to stop, and delivered our, well my, I guess, finds to the group leader. Gears, a solemn man with a toolbelt at his waist, just smiled sadly at me and took the blueprint, the drugs, and the mattress. We then spent another hour hashing out a map of the place based on our movements. Because we would be going back tomorrow, once our lungs cleared up some (hey, I said we were crazy). I set my Screaming Alarm Clock (it's a really long story for how got that thing) to an hour before we agreed to wake up. In the morning, I got up, and quickly silenced my clock. Luckily no one else had roused from their places around our campsite. We had spread out some, so that the zombies wouldn't focus in on us too much, anyway, so no one was that close together. I walked over to our supplies, and grabbed a Battery Launcher Mk. II and two batteries. If all went well, I'd only need one, but hey, better safe than sorry. I walked over to the entrance to the hospital, braced myself physically and mentally, and rushed in. What I found in there... well it wasn't pretty, and it was moving. It wasn't a tough job, it wasn't a tenth of what he had been. I did what I had to do, grabbed his riot shield, struggled with the vending machine for a minutes to no avail, and got out of there. I took it upon myself to remember this man, this Hero, who went only by Shield, because in the vast and cruel world that we inhabit, if I didn't remember him, there might not be any who would. And because he saved my life from the ravening maws of vicious and voracious beasts. That tends to stick in the mind. I think you can see where this going. I took up his shield, took over his name, and took on his mantle. I became the new Shield. I am Shield, and I will fight the undead until humanity reclaims its rightful place.

-Taken from the writings of Shield, Hero of the Palisades of Misplaced Falsehoods, Savior of the Caverns of Broken Tears, etcetera.
Writing dated to between 13-16 A.O. Approximately 12 to 15 years before the establishment of what scholars have agreed was the first of the permanent walled cities.

Round Two of Die2Write: The Writings of Death begins now. Here is the theme:

The Minds of Murder
There is a lot of tension in death. A big release of emotions as the last breath is blown. From the eyes of the victim to the gleam of a killer's blade, write an interesting story that displays the cogs behind the machine of murder.

Okies I got my creative chi flowing too


Chased
Shadows silently flickered down corridors and empty alleyways as I hastily creep down the abandoned street. Not knowing if it is a trick of my eyes or something else, I pad down the sidewalk on my tiptoes, head up, eyes alert and rucksack full on my back. Trying to breathe lightly, I inhale through my nose and exhale through my mouth, increasing speed; I need to get home quickly.
Home. The word reverbs in my head like the old bass I used to play. The days before it all happened. Over seven days have passed since the zombies first came. They came in hordes eating everyone in their path, ripping the intestines from the living, feasting on lacerated corpses and leaving devastation and chaos in their wake. Now everyone is gone.
Sweat beads on my forehead, drips to my lip and I turn my head to the left and blow it away. I can hear my footsteps echo down the street. Suddenly, the footstep echo quickens. My ears perk, pupils dilate and I increase my pace. Long silhouettes dance from behind me and I know It‚Äôs following me. My right arm tenses, knowing the bowie knife attached to my belt will soon be in my palm.

I‚Äôve never killed a zombie, but I am prepared to. I was lucky; when They first came I was walking home and as the slaughter began, I ran into a motorhome in someone's backyard and hid there watching the onslaught through a slit in the blind. Within a few days, everyone was dead and the covey of zombies had lurched onwards to the next town. Undead stragglers were left behind, hungry and alone; they were savage and quick enough to prey on unfortunate cats and rats and birds.

Running faster, I hear the zombie's ragged breath, seemingly tickling the back of my neck. I smell Its stench, like rotten innards and body odor, the scent permeates through my nose. My heart is in my throat choking me, my body is trembling and my brain says: NOW!
With blind terror driving me I grab my knife, pull it high behind my ear and pivot around on the ball of my foot. Closing my eyes I slash the knife in a sweeping motion towards the zombie. I feel hot goop spray across my face and arms. I slash again, and again and again.
My hands have cramped around the knife handle.Opening my eyes I look down at my hands dripping with blood. Red droplets and spray cover the sidewalk: my Picasso-esque tribute to the apocalypse. My gaze focuses on my opponent. Barely recognizable, moaning, blonde tousled hair streaked with red, It writhed on the concrete like some demonic animal . I step forward cautiously peering at the corpse. Suddenly its swollen eye opens a slit, exposing a bright blue iris focused right at me. A tear zigzags down the grimy cheek, ‚ÄúI thought I was the last‚Äù rattles from deep in its throat. Then it is still.
My eyes open wide in disbelief. A vertigo-like dizziness hits me severely. My heart plummets into my stomach. I gag and choke down my own vomit. Leaning on a wall I, count to 10 and breathe deeply. I stand up straight, adjust my pack on my back and still riding my adrenaline rush, and proceed jogging in the direction I was headed. No footsteps echoing this time as I chant in tune to my rhythmic step ‚Äú It was just a zombie, just a zombie‚Äù .
On december 12, 2013
Colette

Nice story, Joanne. Good to see you joining the writing madness

On december 12, 2013
Jean-Ralphio

**Nuclear Family

We‚Äôll never make it. Half our town will be biten, eaten, and transformed tonight. My friends and maybe even me will add to their already imposing number.
All this because we listened to the wrong madman.
fullbandit found a blueprint for a nuclear reactor yesterday and he said we could even build it! Have you ever heard something so ludicrous: ‚ÄúWe can build a Nuclear Reactor if only we had an engine.‚Äù Laughable.
I suppose, however, that I‚ÄôM the bigger idiot here, because I believed fullbandit and ignored our shaman. Our shaman who already proved he could keep us safe with just a soul! he used SnicKer two day ago to summon an angry rain to melt our siegers. And yesterday again but with Dave‚Äôs soul. He said he could easily do it again tonight, at least i think that‚Äôs what he promised. Sometimes his dialect is a little hard to understand, one thing is for certain, he wants a soul.
A soul.
A nuclear reactor.
How on earth are these two things our only viable options?
Well no one wanted to get their precious hands dirty. And we were out of souls so‚Ä¶

So here I am with fullbandit searching this old gas station for an engine. I‚Äôm so thirsty but I‚Äôve been doing this long enough to know how to get the most out of the little water I have. So I go thirsty while i rummage through the building and garage. Amazing that just 12 hours ago i was excited and hopeful of the future. Before i realized fullbandit was just as mad and half as useful as that shaman.
‚ÄúLets inventory what we‚Äôve found so far shall we?‚Äù fullbandit suggests with nothing but exhaustion in his voice. He pushed himself from behind the building covered in grease.
He could probably taste the contempt I had for him in my glare but I doubt he cared.
‚ÄúSure‚Äù The one word was more than he deserved but i wanted him to see his failure so I opened my bag and emptied my pockets. ‚ÄúWhat were we looking for again fullbandit? Oh right an engine, well let‚Äôs see if I‚Äôve found one‚Ä¶ I found a couple batteries those are real useful. And what‚Äôs this? Some dried out Candy that‚Äôs pretty cool right? That will save us from those monsters for sure‚Äù he nodded ignoring my criticism as if above me. ‚ÄúI found some steroids as if our town doesn‚Äôt have enough of those too fullbandit‚Äù
‚ÄúOh great!‚Äù Here comes his annoying optimism again. Like he has some sort of control over the situation. Looking at his stupid face an amazing idea comes to mind. An idea which will make me the hero of our town. ‚ÄúThose are just what we need!‚Äù He smiles confidently and pets his dog. ‚ÄúMark Scruffalo can use those to carry our engine back to town!‚Äù
Have you ever heard, or seen something which disproves everything you believe, everything you know? Most people react with anger if something suggests that their closely held beliefs are incorrect. But when you actually see proof that you were wrong and you must accept it as truth you feel like a fool. Some people still react angrily when they feel that way, I guess I‚Äôm not that type of person.
‚ÄúOur engine? You found an engine! That‚Äôs great! quick, there‚Äôs still time we can get it home where is it?‚Äù
fullbandit laughed and took me around back and showed me the engine still trapped in an old minivan, surprisingly untouched by rust. ‚ÄúSo, do you know how to get an engine out of a car?‚Äù
I shake my head but i‚Äôm still smiling because I‚Äôll push that van back if i have to.
‚ÄúWell, we‚Äôre in luck buddy because I know, I know how to get an engine out of this vehicle. Let‚Äôs get to work‚Äù
And work we did. For two hours we grunted and swore twisting and pulling and using whatever we could to leverage the hunk of oily metal out of its case. Finally, exhausted, we collapsed: the savior of our town had been wrested free.
fullbandit opened his canteen and drank the hot water offering me a swig. ‚ÄúYou left your water with your batteries and candy right?‚Äù I nodded and drink the generous gift of refreshment.
The sun was starting to set. I stood up to stretch my back, looks like i‚Äôll be the hero of the town after all. ‚ÄúSo fullbandit, what else did you find?‚Äù
He stretched too and laughed a little, ‚ÄúI found a mattress, should give us a little bit of a barricade for the town don‚Äôt you think? And this little box cutter, some food, and a decent piece of wood also this cool elastic band.‚Äù
I smile at him ‚ÄúWhat are we going to do with that band? it‚Äôs not worth bringing along!‚Äù
‚ÄúWell, no we‚Äôll need it to fix the engine but don‚Äôt worry we got all the parts for the engine‚Äù
I blinked, I never even considered the engine being broken. ‚ÄúAre you sure?‚Äù
‚ÄúYeah totally just need a bone to keep the band in place and we‚Äôre all good‚Äù He patted my shoulder.
‚ÄúThe shaman took our bones fullbandit. I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs already used them for whatever he uses them for‚Äù
fullbandit sighed and quickly slid a sharp razor around my throat making a warm necklace. I grabbed my neck and turned around quickly.
‚Äúwe‚Äôd never get the reactor built in time tonight anyway‚Äù
The blood felt warm like the water from the canteen as it flooded my windpipe and erupted from my lips.
fullbandit pushed me down and I watched him slide the little knife from my knee to my hip. I felt nothing, but heard a scratch as my vision faded.
‚ÄúSorry buddy, they say all you leave behind is your bones, and your soul and we need both‚Ä¶‚Äù

On december 14, 2013
Draink

Boots in the Sands

The warriors had offered to die. They had given their utmost charity to keep the loose town together. By the Sun's set, they would be dead, after all it only took the crazies five minutes to bite off one's fingers. The warriors were not cowards, not burdens to the residents. The armed stood front with daring spears at their hips... waiting for the moans.

Whether it was meant to be, Arnold knew there was no turning back. He held his wooden club behind the alignment of guards with spears. Arnold rustled his curly black hair, nervous about the upcoming event. He glanced at the glamorous sunset. Jubilant colors skyrocketing out and calling out for merciless death.

Among the warriors on steep hill, Arnold looked to his left to see a panting friend. The red-faced teenager was holding a splintered club like his in shaky hands. ‚ÄúYou okay, Scott?‚Äù Arnold admired his buddy. Arnold let out a drawn out sigh as he watched the valley below darken.

‚ÄúPeachy,‚Äù Scotty replied, patting his wooden club with unsure hands. Scott's ruffled blonde hair was overshadowed by a bandana he had strapped across his forehead. Scotty only came since Arnold volunteered for the duty. The two highschoolers were in it together, plus Scotty didn't want to be a wuss and wuss out.

The front row held out their spears. ‚ÄúSet!‚Äù A loud voice erupted from a spear-wielding punk. Santiago set his foot into the sands, ‚ÄúPosition!‚Äù He called out with a rough voice, gritting his teeth. Santiago turned and winked at Scotty and grinned. ‚ÄúHead up, Scotty boy.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan it, Santiago.‚Äù

'Hey, hey. No need to get mad, boy-o,‚Äù Santiago turned to eye Arnold with his rumpled up hair. ‚ÄúGet that club ready to bash in these sickos, alright?‚Äù Santiago jeered, snickering at Scotty again.

‚ÄúOh yeah, I'm more than ready,‚Äù Arnold joked, ‚Äúmaybe the sickos'll leave us once they see your buzzcut.‚Äù

Santiago dropped his grin into the sand dunes with his feet. A week ago, before the barber took to being dead, Santiago and his crew had went to get clean buzzcuts. Scotty quit his panting and chuckled as he looked up and looked at Santiago's buzzcut. He turned and saw Santiago's two friends, Jonsie and Todd, flaunting their funny looking hair.

‚ÄúYeah, yeah, okay,‚Äù Santiago shifted his feet and went to face the back. ‚ÄúI'll be back, Arny and Scotty.‚Äù Santagio blew through the sea of warriors with worthless clubs and past the sling-shooters who cowered when they saw Santiago's might. Where was he?

Santiago squinted, covering his eyes from the rising sand in the air. ‚ÄúWhere's Archie?‚Äù He asked a boy packing pellets into his pocket. The boy continued on, showing no interest in the punk that could rip him into halves. ‚ÄúWhere is he?‚Äù Santiago hissed.

The sling-shooter looked up, ‚ÄúOh it's you. I saw Archie loading the carts when we left.‚Äù

Santiago smiled grimly. ‚ÄúYou realize that was twenty minutes ago, correct?‚Äù

He nodded. ‚ÄúGet outta my face please, I have to separate my ammunition.‚Äù
Santiago scowled, cursing through his teeth. ‚ÄúDoes anyone know where Archie is?‚Äù No hands pipped or words uttered, only the clanging of weapons. Santiago shot a look at Arnold, trying to dig an answer out of him.

‚ÄúHey Santiago!‚Äù A dimwit bellowed, ‚ÄúArchie's that short stack, ya?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, Todd. Have you seen him?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou betcha, I saw him like four days ago brushing his teeth.‚Äù

‚ÄúI'ma pummel his face in when I see him!‚Äù Jonsie exclaimed, turning around with a fist in the air. ‚ÄúHe jacked my toothbrush!‚Äù

Santiago sighed. If they didn't get that payload here, they would have just wasted time. Would it better better to pull back and defend the gates? Oh how he wished to see that short stack-

‚ÄúComing through!‚Äù A voice yelled from behind two wooden carts nearing the warriors. ‚ÄúGo, go, go!‚Äù Archie shouted and pushed forward the energized carts. He smiled and clapped, wiping sweat from his face. ‚ÄúHey Santa!‚Äù

‚ÄúIt's Santiago and where were you?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh boy, not this. The others told me to help them put a padlock on the gat-‚Äù

‚ÄúThey locked us out?!‚Äù Santiago screamed, stabbing his spear into the sand's vegetation. He closed in on a fear stricken Archie.

‚ÄúNegatory, well, kind of.‚Äù

The eyes of Santiago lit up, flustering with rage. ‚ÄúNo, no, no...‚Äù Santiago raked his hands through his greasy buzzcut. ‚ÄúWe're bait.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo way!‚Äù Before Archie could quiver in surprise, the sling-shooters jumped into the wooden carts and pushed forward with two people pushing on each cart. Santiago could only turn to see his warriors dive into a battle with no gain.

-

The roars of undead came first. Arnold rushed forward, slapping his club against a sicko's face. He heard an uttering crack, and let the sicko sway his arms in the air as he fell. Arnold caught his breath, a sandy one at that.

‚ÄúWait up, broski,‚Äù Scotty said, patting his friend on the back. ‚ÄúLet's go, I'm ready.‚Äù

Arnold blinked, rubbed his eyes, and scratched at his throat. He was parched and hadn't drank since the morning before. Now at midnight, his stomach grumbled. He was ablazed with a rush of exhausting energy.

The elongated spears kept the enraged crazies at bay for a while. It seemed to work out until three crazies took down a quarter of the group. Packs of undead swarmed the rest, with Todd trying to keep order. He must've asked himself where Santiago was. Where was he anyways? Todd would never know since he was overwhelmed by cold teeth that snapped fingers off in about five minutes.

‚ÄúHoly...‚Äù Scotty watched, losing grip of his club. ‚ÄúLet's do this, dude.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, look.‚Äù Arnold pointed. His finger which could snapped off by cold teeth in about five minutes showed the way to the endless masses of dead overthrowing the warriors. It all went by fast, the sling-shooters desperately blasting indents into skulls, but not fast enough. ‚ÄúGame over, man, game over...‚Äù

-

The tiresome Santiago moved through the frosty desert winds. His spear went ahead of him with each step towards the town's front gates. His swift movement stood no chance against the force of the strong winds. Along with that, Santiago had begun worrying.

He had told the nerd to alert the army about the betrayal and to gather up when they could. Santiago hoped they would come in one piece. He hadn't had time to warn them himself. He had to get to the town before they were swarmed.

‚ÄúAlmost there...‚Äù

Santiago soon saw the glint of torches that centered the fort. He passed over a mossy, wet pile of logs and a heap of scrap cans. Santiago could use some spam. Maybe a sandwich? Don't get ahead of yourself, he thought.

‚ÄúCome on, come on...‚Äù The angered punk charged through the shearing wind, only making a few feet's worth of progress. ‚ÄúDamn you!‚Äù He shouted at the gates. ‚ÄúDamn you if you can hear me!‚Äù He couldn't make it, but he was so close. He and the others weren't going to die for the scum they were protecting.

Through the gleaming light, he grabbed the metal gate. He pounded his fists to it, hearing it rebound and echo out. Thus, echoing out to the creepy shadows shambling towards him. Those weren't his boys, they were sickos.

‚ÄúDon't you do this,‚Äù He pounded his knuckles harder ad harder. ‚ÄúYou just don't do this!‚Äù He kicked and took a step back before gutting the padlock with effortless ease, letting it drop into the sands like his feet.

He shoved through the gates with a thrust of frustration. He shut the gates behind him, letting it rebound and echo to the closing in sickos. Santiago aimed his spear at what he saw first. Eyes watching him from their tents.

‚ÄúStop!‚Äù A grumpy man with a full grown beard edged through his hovel, a dwelling composed of a bent wooden plank and some rusty nails. ‚ÄúStand back, you.‚Äù

Santiago held his spear tighter. Without a doubt, the tip was damaged permanently. ‚ÄúYou know my name, Albert.‚Äù
‚ÄúGo back, now. I mean it.‚Äù

Santiago took the hit. ‚ÄúFor what, huh, just so you can lock me out again with my boys dying back there?‚Äù He craned his neck towards the tiny crowd gathering, looking for answers.

A skinny water boy held up his hand, ‚ÄúWe voted. Take some water if you want.‚Äù He tossed it, the water showering Santiago's feet in the sand. The precious water was as good as gold, and the skinny water boy had just done so to waste it.

‚ÄúYou say something, kid?‚Äù Santiago scoffed, raising his spear. A gasp spread through the residents Santiago had tried to be their savior. Instead, now they were shocked at him. ‚ÄúYou shit!‚Äù He grunted as he leveled the spear above him. ‚ÄúAh!‚Äù

Before he could react, a fist struck his nose and sent a chilling crack through the air. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù He muttered, soon feeling a burst of pain in his gut as a multitude of punches met him. Santiago faltered back after someone with a miniature knife went into his shoulder.

An ungodly scream left Santiago's throat as he tried to regain his balance with his feet in the sand, but ultimately collapsed to the floor with a sorrowful cry. He landed outside into the cold, barren, dark wasteland outside. The only light had marked the shadows of the dead getting closer and closer.

The poor punk looked up from the entanglement of vegetation as Albert went to seal the gates once and for all. ‚ÄúYou son of a...‚Äù Santiago tried to keep the gates open with a hand, but felt his bones ache and was sent down... Through the darkness, only the shutting of the gate's echoed, followed by ghostly, rising moans.

On december 15, 2013
robot6000

Title: Robot`s Regret.

(Stacic sound) testing testing... this thing on? should know better to put faith in a peace of shi oh!? its on... well I got to get this off my chest so here go`s. Been a day or two now since I left town why I left town? some sick fuck made the well our only place to get water our water the thing you & I need to live red with the blood of those those THINGS!!! ya Im talking about them those dead fucks! the one that used to be your doctor or your drug dealer or your best & only friend...*deep breath* but I know how it happened & who did it yes I know who did it I know the sick fuck the sick fuck is*deeper breath* is me... me now if you don`t know who I am if you find this I am Robot6000 but call me Robot don`t know how I am Robot don`t ask me... or kill me so how it happened well it was day two or three I think & the town was full of dick heads they would do so many things like drink there water or eat there food for no reson & when they ran out they robed each outer and never did any thing but for some reson they would all hate me they would try to make a reson to shun me but they were to pussy to just shun me becuse some tale of some crow but it all started to happen when I came back Chuck some guy that like the outers hated me came to me & said "you fucker you killed him!" "I don`t know what" "shut the fuck up!... guys" he said with a smile as I see three no! fore men Chuck cuts my face & pushs me to the ground & all of them start beating me & when it was over Chuck spits on me & said "your hanged tomorow" & as I sumble home I see pepole stairing at me & as im walking it hit me Chuck did it he kill someone to frame me. Then I`d sanped & a joult of fear/rage went through me & I ran to the frist part of my plan jom`s house jom was eaten just last & nobody had taken care of him so I teared off some rags that used to be his shirt & dabed it on what used to be his jugulars & headed to the well. I guess you know what happened I tossed the rags in the well & ran out of town & it hit me when I was about to leave the kids... they`ll all die I was blinded by rage so much that they`ll all die but for some reson I just keep walking with what I hope was not the last peace of clean water of this world...
On december 17, 2013
MadDonut

If I Bleed For You..

Blood oozes from the neck wound and filters through my fingers as his wide open eyes twitched for the last time before freezing into a dull, eerie glaze. I yank my silvery love free of his throat. Its red smile glistens when it leaves, being thrilled and pleasured by the feeling of its first living kill. Blood spurts out from the wound, catching my shoulder, soaking my sleeve, and staining the sands as I stare into the lifeless eyes.

My gaze drew from our victim and to my love, which stands aloft in shimmering brilliance of sunlight with droplets of red falling from its fine curves. I hold my love happily upwards to boast its accomplishment, keeping it tight in my one-handed grasp. I gently bring its broad side to my lips and kiss it softly, feeling the stimulating metallic texture bring warmth to my heart and soul. Red dribbles from my mouth, down my chin, and onto the face of our victim.

I hadn't doubted my love's capabilities and it hadn't failed me. I move back over the body, steadying on my knees as I carry up the head of our victim into my chest with my open arm. I cradle our victim and thank him for his sacrifice as I plunge my love into his side, cutting deep into the liver. He jiggles limply as I stab firmly. Slowly sliding my love through his flesh, allowing it to savor the feeling of flesh.

But my love grew tiresome of this flesh.
As our victim's body loses its final essence of life each second, my love demanded fresher flesh.
"But my sweet love," I whisper. "I said we'd only do it once.."
It is quiet.
"Yes, my love. I did enjoy it too. I love to see you happy, but.."
It remains silent.
I sigh and say, "As you wish, my love."

I let go of our victim, watching him drop onto the ground, sending up a small cloud of blood-stained sand. He fell so sadly, like a child maturing and letting go of its stuffed companion for the last time, seeing no more magic in the object. There he lays, the red tainted sand clung to his clothes, to his lips, and to his eyes without even the slightest of reactions. He is so idle and hallow. I had known him well, and he was a good fellow. He was the favored scavenger of the town ever since his discovery of an old, rusty engine. The engine was used to make a chainsaw which had helped out the town considerably with the nightly attacks by the rotten. It's powerful teeth tore through the rotten's bones and tendon with brutal force, making slaying them a joyous and simplistic task.

My love immediately began to grow deeply envious of it, claiming I loved the chainsaw more than it. So I sabotaged the chainsaw to make my love happy and prove my truthful love. I broke it apart and tossed it into the ground, cracking it open like a rotten's skull. Before the chainsaw was created, my love was satisfied by the rotten's flesh, which had been enough to sate my love's blood thirst. Then my love grew bitter and angry, demanding an extreme despite my protest and efforts. It wanted the warm flesh of the living.

I hoped, as I offered my services as an escort, that it would satisfy my love to slay the one that caused it so much grief. But my love is greedy now, and I love it too much to deny its desires. So I ambushed him when he was unaware and trusting in me, cutting deep into his neck. There he lays now, stagnant and lifeless. Up the sandy slopes I tromp, towards the town, my blade in hand and shirt soaked in blood. I smile to hide my grief from my love as blood drops fall inside my footprints. I don't want to ruin our moment now, not when she was this happy. The slowly lowering sun silhouetted my form as my love glistens a bright cherry hue. My love shall be merry for the rest of my life, even if it kills me.


Hours later, with most of the town slain, I am heading through wasteland to nowhere. My love echoes madly as I tiredly trudge on, screaming about needing more blood. Blood, blood, blood, blood! I finally grow too weary and jam its handle into the ground, blade up so it could hear me. I yell at it for its cruelty and curse at it for what I had lost for it. As I spill my feelings, it still calls for the spilling of blood. I try screaming louder, but its demands overpowered me. Giving up, I turn and try to flee from the noise, but my leg catches on a metal shard and twists inhumanly. I collapse beside my love and howl in agony. I cry and beg, asking my love to be merciful and silence itself. It continues on, ignoring my pleads completely as I lay at its side. I become angry and desperate to cease my pains.

"You want blood?!" I yell at it. "Take mine!"

With that, I push up with my arms to gain height with all my aching might and drop back to the ground a few inches from where the imprint of my impact was, landing with all my weight on my love. It jabs deep into my chest and I begin to choke each breath I breathe. It didn't stop, even as I offered my final gift, as I shifted myself onto my back. I taste blood deep in my throat as it seeps up to my lips. I feel about the wound with my numbing, already bloody hands. I feel upon my love's handle and the feeling of my own cold blood. I raise my hand to the sky, droplets of red falling like a rain of wine. One drop falls on my glabella and glazes over my vision. All I see is red and a blackness where my knife has dug into my flesh and bone. I lay back, staring at a dark, falling sun as it all fades away. My love silences just before I pass and blissful memories flash in my mind.
I smile.
I die tonight.
On december 17, 2013
DarkTheRaven

uhhh... is Donut considered a judge? I mean, posting for fun if you're a judge is understandable but... competitively... questionable
On december 17, 2013
MadDonut
DarkTheRavenuhhh... is Donut considered a judge? I mean, posting for fun if you're a judge is understandable but... competitively... questionable

No, I am not a judge nor do I have any legal ability to 'cheat' or unjustly and unfairly alter my score in any way. BlackVoid, Rosslessness, you (DarkTheRaven) are the three, and only, judges.

Just because I organize the event doesn't mean I cannot partake in its competition.

Another reason why I prefer to have volunteer judges.

On december 17, 2013
DarkTheRaven

you evil pastry, I hope you're in the next batch in the muffin mans bakery, he quit muffins now he's general pastries, including donuts

On december 17, 2013
MadDonut
DarkTheRavenyou evil pastry, I hope you're in the next batch in the muffin mans bakery, he quit muffins now he's general pastries, including donuts

I'm not evil. In fact, I'm a very sweet person.
However, do ignore these sheets of paper covered in my evil plots for world domination via a secondary nuclear catastrophe.


Jokes aside, I'm writing for the masses to enjoy. It's to be judged as an equal to all the other entries, and I expect those who became judges for this contest to do so.

This contest isn't about me at all (even as grand as The Almighty Pastry is). It's a way for the Die2Nite community to express their fandom through text. This is a text-based browser game, full of flavor text and marvelous stories. Amazing player-written stories should be one of the most prominent hallmarks of our community.
