On december 18, 2013
Draink

After a discussion with the whimsical donut , I must now post this edited version:


Boots in the Dunes
by Sporeface Draink

The warriors had offered to die. They had given their utmost charity to keep the loose town together. By the Sun's set, they would be dead, after all it only took the crazies five minutes to bite off one's fingers. The warriors were not cowards, not burdens to the residents. The armed stood front with daring spears at their hips... waiting for the moans.

Whether it was meant to be, Arnold knew there was no turning back. He held his wooden club behind the alignment of guards with spears. Arnold rustled his curly black hair, nervous about the upcoming event. He glanced at the glamorous sunset. Jubilant colors skyrocketing out and calling out for merciless death.

Among the warriors on steep hill, Arnold looked to his left to see a panting friend. The red-faced teenager was holding a splintered club like his in shaky hands. ‚ÄúYou okay, Scott?‚Äù Arnold admired his buddy. Arnold let out a drawn out sigh as he watched the valley below darken.

‚ÄúPeachy,‚Äù Scotty replied, patting his wooden club with unsure hands. Scott's ruffled blonde hair was overshadowed by a bandana he had strapped across his forehead. Scotty only came since Arnold volunteered for the duty. The two highschoolers were in it together, plus Scotty didn't want to be a wuss and wuss out.

The front row held out their spears. ‚ÄúSet!‚Äù A loud voice erupted from a spear-wielding punk. Santiago set his foot into the sands, ‚ÄúPosition!‚Äù He called out with a rough voice, gritting his teeth. Santiago turned and winked at Scotty and grinned. ‚ÄúHead up, Scotty boy.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan it, Santiago.‚Äù

'Hey, hey. No need to get mad, boy-o,‚Äù Santiago turned to eye Arnold with his rumpled up hair. ‚ÄúGet that club ready to bash in these sickos, alright?‚Äù Santiago jeered, snickering at Scotty again.

‚ÄúOh yeah, I'm more than ready,‚Äù Arnold joked, ‚Äúmaybe the sickos'll leave us once they see your buzzcut.‚Äù

Santiago dropped his grin into the sand dunes with his feet. A week ago, before the barber took to being dead, Santiago and his crew had went to get clean buzzcuts. Scotty quit his panting and chuckled as he looked up and looked at Santiago's buzzcut. He turned and saw Santiago's two friends, Jonsie and Todd, flaunting their funny looking hair.

‚ÄúYeah, yeah, okay,‚Äù Santiago shifted his feet and went to face the back. ‚ÄúI'll be back, Arny and Scotty.‚Äù Santagio blew through the sea of warriors with worthless clubs and past the sling-shooters who cowered when they saw Santiago's might. Where was he?

Santiago squinted, covering his eyes from the rising sand in the air. ‚ÄúWhere's Archie?‚Äù He asked a boy packing pellets into his pocket. The boy continued on, showing no interest in the punk that could rip him into halves. ‚ÄúWhere is he?‚Äù Santiago hissed.

The sling-shooter looked up, ‚ÄúOh it's you. I saw Archie loading the carts when we left.‚Äù

Santiago smiled grimly. ‚ÄúYou realize that was twenty minutes ago, correct?‚Äù

He nodded. ‚ÄúGet outta my face please, I have to separate my ammunition.‚Äù
Santiago scowled, cursing through his teeth. ‚ÄúDoes anyone know where Archie is?‚Äù No hands pipped or words uttered, only the clanging of weapons. Santiago shot a look at Arnold, trying to dig an answer out of him.

‚ÄúHey Santiago!‚Äù A dimwit bellowed, ‚ÄúArchie's that short stack, ya?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, Todd. Have you seen him?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou betcha, I saw him like four days ago brushing his teeth.‚Äù

‚ÄúI'ma pummel his face in when I see him!‚Äù Jonsie exclaimed, turning around with a fist in the air. ‚ÄúHe jacked my toothbrush!‚Äù

Santiago sighed. If they didn't get that payload here, they would have just wasted time. Would it better better to pull back and defend the gates? Oh how he wished to see that short stack-

‚ÄúComing through!‚Äù A voice yelled from behind two wooden carts nearing the warriors. ‚ÄúGo, go, go!‚Äù Archie shouted and pushed forward the energized carts. He smiled and clapped, wiping sweat from his face. ‚ÄúHey Santa!‚Äù

‚ÄúIt's Santiago and where were you?‚Äù

‚ÄúOh boy, not this. The others told me to help them put a padlock on the gat-‚Äù

‚ÄúThey locked us out?!‚Äù Santiago screamed, stabbing his spear into the sand's vegetation. He closed in on a fear stricken Archie.

‚ÄúNegatory, well, kind of.‚Äù

The eyes of Santiago lit up, flustering with rage. ‚ÄúNo, no, no...‚Äù Santiago raked his hands through his greasy buzzcut. ‚ÄúWe're bait.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo way!‚Äù Before Archie could quiver in surprise, the sling-shooters jumped into the wooden carts and pushed forward with two people pushing on each cart. Santiago could only turn to see his warriors dive into a battle with no gain.

-

The roars of undead came first. Arnold rushed forward, slapping his club against a sicko's face. He heard an uttering crack, and let the sicko sway his arms in the air as he fell. Arnold caught his breath, a sandy one at that.

‚ÄúWait up, broski,‚Äù Scotty said, patting his friend on the back. ‚ÄúLet's go, I'm ready.‚Äù

Arnold blinked, rubbed his eyes, and scratched at his throat. He was parched and hadn't drank since the morning before. Now at midnight, his stomach grumbled. He was ablazed with a rush of exhausting energy.

The elongated spears kept the enraged crazies at bay for a while. It seemed to work out until three crazies took down a quarter of the group. Packs of undead swarmed the rest, with Todd trying to keep order. He must've asked himself where Santiago was. Where was he anyways? Todd would never know since he was overwhelmed by cold teeth that snapped fingers off in about five minutes.

‚ÄúHoly...‚Äù Scotty watched, losing grip of his club. ‚ÄúLet's do this, dude.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, look.‚Äù Arnold pointed. His finger which could snapped off by cold teeth in about five minutes showed the way to the endless masses of dead overthrowing the warriors. It all went by fast, the sling-shooters desperately blasting indents into skulls, but not fast enough. ‚ÄúGame over, man, game over...‚Äù

-

The tiresome Santiago moved through the frosty desert winds. His spear went ahead of him with each step towards the town's front gates. His swift movement stood no chance against the force of the strong winds. Along with that, Santiago had begun worrying.

He had told the nerd to alert the army about the betrayal and to gather up when they could. Santiago hoped they would come in one piece. He hadn't had time to warn them himself. He had to get to the town before they were swarmed.

‚ÄúAlmost there...‚Äù

Santiago soon saw the glint of torches that centered the fort. He passed over a mossy, wet pile of logs and a heap of scrap cans. Santiago could use some spam. Maybe a sandwich? Don't get ahead of yourself, he thought.

‚ÄúCome on, come on...‚Äù The angered punk charged through the shearing wind, only making a few feet's worth of progress. ‚ÄúDamn you!‚Äù He shouted at the gates. ‚ÄúDamn you if you can hear me!‚Äù He couldn't make it, but he was so close. He and the others weren't going to die for the scum they were protecting.

Through the gleaming light, he grabbed the metal gate. He pounded his fists to it, hearing it rebound and echo out. Thus, echoing out to the creepy shadows shambling towards him. Those weren't his boys, they were sickos.

‚ÄúDon't you do this,‚Äù He pounded his knuckles harder ad harder. ‚ÄúYou just don't do this!‚Äù He kicked and took a step back before gutting the padlock with effortless ease, letting it drop into the sands like his feet.

He shoved through the gates with a thrust of frustration. He shut the gates behind him, letting it rebound and echo to the closing in sickos. Santiago aimed his spear at what he saw first. Eyes watching him from their tents.

‚ÄúStop!‚Äù A grumpy man with a full grown beard edged through his hovel, a dwelling composed of a bent wooden plank and some rusty nails. ‚ÄúStand back, you.‚Äù

Santiago held his spear tighter. Without a doubt, the tip was damaged permanently. ‚ÄúYou know my name, Albert.‚Äù
‚ÄúGo back, now. I mean it.‚Äù

Santiago took the hit. ‚ÄúFor what, huh, just so you can lock me out again with my boys dying back there?‚Äù He craned his neck towards the tiny crowd gathering, looking for answers.

A skinny water boy held up his hand, ‚ÄúWe voted. Take some water if you want.‚Äù He tossed it, the water showering Santiago's feet in the sand. The precious water was as good as gold, and the skinny water boy had just done so to waste it.

‚ÄúYou say something, kid?‚Äù Santiago scoffed, raising his spear. A gasp spread through the residents Santiago had tried to be their savior. Instead, now they were shocked at him. ‚ÄúYou shit!‚Äù He grunted as he leveled the spear above him. ‚ÄúAh!‚Äù

Before he could react, a fist struck his nose and sent a chilling crack through the air. ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù He muttered, soon feeling a burst of pain in his gut as a multitude of punches met him. Santiago faltered back after someone with a miniature knife went into his shoulder.

An ungodly scream left Santiago's throat as he tried to regain his balance with his boots in the sand, but ultimately collapsed to the floor with a sorrowful cry. He landed outside into the cold, barren, dark wasteland outside. The only light had marked the shadows of the dead getting closer and closer.

The poor punk looked up from the entanglement of vegetation as Albert went to seal the gates once and for all. ‚ÄúYou son of a...‚Äù Santiago tried to keep the gates open with a hand, but felt his bones ache and send him down. Through the darkness, only the shutting of the gate's echoed, followed by ghostly, rising moans.

Round Three of Die2Write: The Writings of Death , the final round, begins now. Here is the theme:

What Happens After Life?
Death is no big deal in Die2Nite since it happens all the time. Nobody seems to give a person's passing a second thought. We're so used to it that no one asks the question that seemed to torture the minds of those before the apocalypse: What happens to me after I die? What awaits me when my mortal life ends? What if we were to all die? What would that world be like? Describe that world, writer.

On january 17, 2014
Sinister

The Recurring Nightmare

I was sleeping in my cozy tent last night when i had a dream, it was simple dream about me strolling in the dessert. I was scavenging for food and i walk to the south out of my town when i realized i was being stalked by something, it wasn't zombie, nor ghouls, i dismissed it as a mirage. You know when you're out in the dessert for so long you become hallucinative and start imagining things it happens all the time, but this isn't an imagination.

I was still scavenging when i look back at the thing, he was there, he was always there. He wore an old dusty white jacket with a hood that was covering half of his face i can only see his mouth from the distance it stretches from ear to ear, his teeth is jagged almost spiky and its coated in what looks like fresh blood that drips from his mouth into his jacket. I was unnerved, no one wears jacket like that not in this blazing hell and his presence concerns me like he was always watching my every move. I keep moving south i don't even care about scavenging anymore i just want to keep myself as far as i can from that thing.

i arrived in new part of dessert i looked back and there he was, standing even closer than before he smiled at me and stretches his arm it looks like a pole, long and slender with five long razor sharp finger dripping with blood. There's still something stuck in it, it looks like intestine of god knows what. Before i knew it he started to charge towards me mouth opening wider than anything i have ever seen before, now i can see the full extent of his knife like teeth still with some leftover meat clinging to it, how can that teeth fit in his mouth? i wonder. He runs very fast and jumps really high, all while he was shrieking like a banshee, i started to run like hell, the dessert seems endless but at the corner of my eyes i caught something that looks like citizens house maybe i can hide there.

As i reached the citizens house the dream abruptly ended, i woke up in my tent covered in sweat and breathing heavily, i don't think much about it. Nightmare is common nowadays every now and then you hear people screaming from their tent, sometimes nightmare sometimes they're being munched to death by zeds, but it occasionaly happens around here. I go to sleep the next day just before the attack the watchmen are professional so i think i'm safe enough from the zeds, although nobody warns me about the danger i will face in my dreams.

I dreamed of the exact same thing, today i barely outrun him to the citizens house before the dream ends again. I cannot sleep for the coming days i decided to keep myself awake by joining the ranks of watchmen. It was sucessful for a few days i'm awake and i stayed away from sleeping for a day or two. But at the third day i just lost it i fell asleep and the other watchmen have to carry me into my tent. Before i knew it there i was again in the middle of the dessert.

My days in the watchmen duty may have lifted my confidence a bit, killing some zombies may just have been the right exercise to kill whatever that unholy creature is, i have never been so wrong no zombies can ever prepare me to meet the horror from this thing. I'm prepared, i picked up a hurling stick that was laying around, for the first time ever i will make my stance if i die here then that's my fate and i'm ready to face him i'd rather die in peace than to face shit over and over again.

There he was smiling with his bloody teeth i see the terror in his face and i'm starting to lost my composure but i hold up, i regret my decision to stay and fight but it was too late. He came straight at me, i swung my stick all over the place in hope of hitting him, i don't care anymore i just want him dead. Suddenly i hit something it was his head it was bashed in i hit him a couple more time while cussing at him, you can never be too sure you know. Then i left his body there and walk away feeling like a champion, suddenly i realized there was a huge oozing wound on my right hand the damn thing bit me, and in my vigorous strike i didn't even know it, it was bleeding really badly and the wound shaped like a bite mark, i kept walking holding my wound it hurts so bad, then i look back at where the body supposed to be, it was gone, what's left is just a big puddle of blood from the thing and my own blood.

i was walking around for what feels like a lifetime when i saw a building, likely a citizens house my vision is blurry and i have a nasty nausea i was waiting to die at that moment because i have lost too much blood. Then i walk to the ruined house, what a pleasant place to die at the very least i didn't die in the middle of a dessert. my wounds is just too great of a pain to bare and i passed out. Then i woke up in sweat and i realized that it was all just a dream and there is no monster like that in this world at least, and then just like that you looked at your right hand it was a bite mark with a fresh blood, still dripping from it

On january 22, 2014
Draink

Curiosity


No one had given the slightest thought that day to what was beyond our prosperous defenses. No one had a clue what was on the horizon. It was a solemn day with the residents laying back on their soiled cots. Cheering. Singing. Not giving a rat's ass to what would come.

Until Clyde rushed into the gates looking like he had climbed the tallest point in the desert wastes. Whoever in our city heard his shouts of terror came to the front of our great fortifications. I was checking stock at our bank, passing out soggy bags with soggy food rations. On a solemn day.

‚ÄúWhat's he going off about?‚Äù I concentrated my eyes on a weathered, restless man. Danny was his name. He turned to me and shrugged his shoulders and took his soggy bag with soggy food rations. No curiosity marked his buggery eyes.

‚ÄúIt's the desert,‚Äù said a woman, Carolyn, from the dusty shelves that held some punctured cans of beans. ‚ÄúTold 'im to not go wandering off for the night.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe stayed outside for the night?‚Äù At the moment it seemed I was the only living soul in town who wanted to know why Clyde was wailing and shoving people away from him when he staggered into the town.

Carolyn nodded and adjusted her hair bun. She rubbed her bloodshot eyes, looking like she had been crying for days. ‚ÄúHe and his friend,‚Äù she paused, ‚Äúthe skinny one.‚Äù

‚ÄúSnyder?‚Äù Of course it was Snyder. He was the lively hippie with the guitar Clyde had salvaged parts for the week before. Was it a week? Probably, since that was the day Carolyn's sister was overwhelmed by the snarling monsters that came from the darkness. ‚ÄúIs he out there with Clyde?‚Äù

I think everyone could have used one of Snyder's cheerful Les Paul tunes today. Within our great walls of protecting metal plates. ‚ÄúHe's dead.‚Äù My eyes went to Danny. Curiosity crossed his face. ‚ÄúI just went out there. He keeps shouting 'they got'em! They got my friend!'‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you sure?‚Äù I asked.

‚ÄúDid I stutter?‚Äù Whatever curiosity he had had vanished like remains of Carolyn's sister when the monsters hobbled off into their Darkness.

I had this tingling sensation that made me leave my post. I found myself strolling past Danny and through his retreating lust for what was soon to come. Then past Carolyn, who had taken to herself. Wiping at her eyes. ‚ÄúHey-‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can take it.‚Äù I blurted out. The next moment, I was outside with the blonde sand particles biting at my face. There was Clyde, huddled on the floor in fetal position. ‚ÄúIs he okay?‚Äù

Clyde let out a long, horrendous yelp. ‚ÄúWhat do you think?‚Äù said one of the watchmen. ‚ÄúWe keep trying to stand him up, but it seems his legs are crippled.‚Äù


Clyde was rolling in the masses of sand. His brown, torn shirt went with him and was, by the time I saw him, covered in sand. He was muttering to himself, keeping a hand cupped on his left ear. Something about Carolyn's sister.

‚ÄúDid you try getting that hand o-‚Äù Before I could finish, Clyde shot up and lunged at the group of irritated watchmen. Curiosity left me. Common sense slapped me across the face.

‚ÄúI'm sorry!‚Äù Clyde shouted as he landed on an unfortunate member of the brave watchmen. The ones who were supposed to keep the city secure. ‚ÄúS-snyder‚Äù And then a shining dagger escaped from the depths of Clyde's dirty trousers and into the watchman's chest.

I had watched the watchmen get butchered before my eyes. Ironic. As the residents leaped up from their cots or zipped up their tents, I froze there. Froze staring at Clyde's left ear. Where it should have been. The monsters wouldn't do that and leave him alive. Something with a mind did that. On purpose.

Before I could utter the word, Clyde himself rose from the watchman's dying body and slid out the dagger. His eyes were terrified and made to petrify me as I stood motionless. ‚ÄúClyde,‚Äù I stopped to dodge his blade and land on the prosperous walls that had defended us from the monsters. And the Ghouls.

The realization hit me as soon as the cold blade met my throat. I had gulped, dragging my eyes to Clyde's terrified eyes. Eyes that had seen his best friend mauled by a pathetic ghoul. The same ones who had seen Carolyn's body hauled away by the ghoul.

The one's who had stared down at the ghoul right before he was slain with his own dagger.

At that pristine moment, I found out that there was no need to struggle. All Clyde had to do was move the blade a little centimeter to cut his jugular. No, Clyde wouldn't want that. He stood there and fixated upon the dagger he held so firmly. ‚ÄúSnyder...‚Äù

Before I could blink, Clyde tore the shining blade through the air. I was expecting a quick death. I didn't open my eyes when the blade swooshed through the air. Not when Carolyn stood herself petrified like stone behind me at the bank's window panel.

Instead, I merely cranked an eye open. Right on time to see the life drain from the traumatized eyes of Clyde Morrison. The brother of Snyder Morrison. The last of the Morrison's gasped for air as he held the dagger to his own hiccuping chest.

When Clyde sucked in his last breath of sandy air and came to a rest on his side, I thought of doing the same. The two of us laid back with me huffing and puffing. The sand was cool, not burning hot like I had predicted it would be.

A fine day for some Les Paul tunes.
On january 22, 2014
Jean-Ralphio

The Humor of the Crows
OH GOD!
Please let me rest! Not again, I just want...
I want the rest.
fullbandit betrayed me! He butchered me for a bone.
FOR A BONE!!!
It barely hurt to be honest, a sharp blade isn't the worst way to die. But rebirth.
Rebirth is where the pain becomes real.
Time means nothing, nothing means anything during your limbo until your next stretch of life. When the hot air fills your lungs with fire and your heart spasms blood to carry that fire to your brain so that it may spark forth and become a vessel for your soul if for only a few days.
The pain hasn't begun yet. Why has the eternity of sorrow begun yet? Why can I watch fullbandit carry my bone back to town?
Why is fullbandit carrying me back to town?
Why do i care? The pain is postponed at least. Perhaps even eliminated.
Oh but if the crows were so kind. So forgiving.
"We learn from the searing agony don't we my old friend?" That voice, no more of a whisper. "Your death will save many tonight, try to focus on that through your suffering. Do try"

The Shaman. fullbandit has brought back all that remains of me to the Shaman.
The night is invisible to me now, but I can feel the anticipation and fear of my old companions now and i know the sun has set.
Shapes and colors aren't clear to me anymore all that I perceive is emotions and thoughts. Until a glowing face is all that I experience.

The shamans horrible mask! It consumes all that I know and hums an alien hymn. The mouth moves as freely as any living man and all that i knew of the pain of life and death are forgotten and the indescribable torment of rebirth becomes all that i wish for.
The mask breaths and I can feel my essence being sucked forward. like a wind that pulls your hair from your skin then your skin from your bones.
"EEEEEHHHHHH YYYYYYYEAAAAAHHHHH!!!!!!!" I scream like steam coming from a whistle. And with one last inhale, I fill him. Now inside his body he has complete control over all that I am and he slowly chants in an ancient language too terrifying to focus on. I experience the impossible.
My bones being tore from my skin.
From inside my skin.
Then the Shaman holds his breath and i feel everything dissected, what was once one is now 100 thousand. and i can feel all 100 thousand of my pain. Slowly, so horribly slowly he breaths me out in pieces as all 100 thousand of me raise to the air and form clouds.
Most of me feels nothing any longer but senses the dozens of hopeful living in the town below. And just as all of me is at peace. Real peace. It ends.
Simply ends.
Rebirth begins and it hurts the way it always does. But I know now that being put back together is nothing compared to being torn apart.
On january 31, 2014
Blaire
